meanings.definition: The state or quality of being multiple or manifold.
meanings.sent1: The multiplicities of colors in the painting made it truly beautiful.
meanings.sent2: She was amazed by the multiplicities of talents he possessed.
meanings.sent3: The multiplicities of flavors in the ice cream shop made it a popular spot in town.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of multiplicities, each thought blooming into a new idea.
meanings.sent5: The multiplicities of stars in the night sky took her breath away.

meanings.sent1: The multiplicities of books in the library provided endless options for reading.
meanings.sent2: The multiplicities of flowers in the garden created a vibrant and colorful display.
meanings.sent3: The multiplicities of animals at the zoo kept the visitors entertained all day.
meanings.sent4: His music collection was a treasure trove of multiplicities, from classical to rock.
meanings.sent5: The multiplicities of fruits at the market tempted her with their freshness.
